Class Player

java.lang.Object
william.txtgame.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
Player class representing a player in the game. This class holds the player's health points (HP), magic points (MP), and the maximum values for both HP and MP. It also provides getters and setters for these attributes with logic to ensure that HP and MP do not exceed their maximum values.
Author:
William
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getHp

      public int getHp()
      Gets the current health points of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's current health points

    • setHp

      public void setHp(int hp)
      Sets the health points of the player. If the value exceeds the maximum HP, it is capped at the max HP.
      Parameters:
      hp - The health points to set

    • getMp

      public int getMp()
      Gets the current magic points of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's current magic points

    • setMp

      public void setMp(int mp)
      Sets the magic points of the player. If the value exceeds the maximum MP, it is capped at the max MP.
      Parameters:
      mp - The magic points to set

    • getMaxHp

      public int getMaxHp()
      Gets the maximum health points the player can have.
      Returns:
      The player's maximum health points

    • setMaxHp

      public void setMaxHp(int maxHp)
      Sets the maximum health points for the player. If the player's current HP exceeds the new max HP, the HP is set to the new max.
      Parameters:
      maxHp - The maximum health points to set

    • getMaxMp

      public int getMaxMp()
      Gets the maximum magic points the player can have.
      Returns:
      The player's maximum magic points

    • setMaxMp

      public void setMaxMp(int maxMp)
      Sets the maximum magic points for the player. If the player's current MP exceeds the new max MP, the MP is set to the new max.
      Parameters:
      maxMp - The maximum magic points to set
